Title: "Managing Azure AI Search with PowerShell: Indexing and Private Links"
Text:
C:\Users\adamh\Downloads\azure-search.pdfAzure PowerShellSet-AzSearchService -ResourceGroupName <search-service-resource-group-name> -Name <search-service-name> -PartitionCount 6 -ReplicaCount 6ResourceGroupName : demo-westusName              : my-demo-searchappLocation          : West USSku               : StandardReplicaCount      : 6PartitionCount    : 6HostingMode       : DefaultId                : /subscriptions/65a1016d-0f67-45d2-b838-b8f373d6d52e/resourceGroups/demo-westus/providers/Microsoft.
Search/searchServices/my-demo-searchappCreate a shared private link resourceNew-AzSearchSharedPrivateLinkResource -ResourceGroupName <search-serviceresource-group-name> -ServiceName <search-service-name> -Name <spl-Get-AzSearchSharedPrivateLinkResource allows you to retrieve the shared private linkresources and view their status.Azure PowerShellYou'll need to approve the connection with the following command before it can beused.Azure PowerShellRemove-AzSearchSharedPrivateLinkResource is used to delete the shared private linkresource.
Azure PowerShellFor full details on setting up shared private link resources, see the documentation onmaking indexer connections through a private endpoint.Build an index, query an index using the portal, REST APIs, or the .NET SDK.Create an Azure AI Search index in the Azure portalSet up an indexer to load data from other servicesQuery an Azure AI Search index using Search explorer in the Azure portalname> -PrivateLinkResourceId /subscriptions/<alphanumeric-subscription-ID>/resourceGroups/<storage-resource-group-name>/providers/Microsoft. Storage/storageAccounts/myBlobStorage -GroupId <group-id> -RequestMessage "Please approve" Get-AzSearchSharedPrivateLinkResource -ResourceGroupName <search-service-resource-group-name> -ServiceName <search-service-name> -Name <spl-name>Approve-AzPrivateEndpointConnection `    -Name <spl-name> `    -ServiceName <search-service-name>
